body_html:
I've been hitting the same issue with modified code, using pytorch at commit 9193dfd and a slightly older version.

However, I haven't been hitting this issue (yet?) in code that doesn't use CIFAR 10 or the pytorch DataLoader or Dataset classes. I'll repost if this changes.

The modified code is just cleaned up to allow any arbitrary stack of modules in a block, so it involves a lot less manual passing of parameters and the like: https://github.com/veugene/pytorch-revnet/tree/generic

I am however hitting a segfault consistently with a different call to grad() in a custom function but that's a separate issue to post.

body:
I've been hitting the same issue with modified code, using pytorch at commit 9193dfd185ac526d0d71c6fd100a52b0b2e10e58 and a slightly older version.

However, I haven't been hitting this issue (yet?) in code that doesn't use CIFAR 10 or the pytorch DataLoader or Dataset classes. I'll repost if this changes.

The modified code is just cleaned up to allow any arbitrary stack of modules in a block, so it involves a lot less manual passing of parameters and the like: https://github.com/veugene/pytorch-revnet/tree/generic

I am however hitting a segfault consistently with a different call to grad() in a custom function but that's a separate issue to post.
